summary: Project now includes stabilizing client onboarding UI loading to prevent backend actor-not-ready errors ("Actor not available").
architectural_notes: During onboarding, frontend should gate calls on backend actor/canister readiness (e.g., retry/backoff or wait-for-ready) to prevent "Actor not available".
known_issues: Onboarding can show "Actor not available" when frontend calls backend actor before deployment/upgrade is ready.

existing_features.title: Prevent the Onboard Client flow from submitting any backend mutations until the backend actor is fully ready, so onboarding never surfaces the raw error text "Actor not available" during normal loading/upgrade windows.

Update the onboarding page UI to handle actor readiness explicitly: show a stable, non-flickering loading experience and avoid transient enable/disable states while the actor is being created/invalidated.
Harden error normalization so that if an actor-not-ready error still occurs (edge cases), the user-facing message is friendly English and does not display "Actor not available" verbatim.

new_feature_requests.summary: Stabilize onboarding loading state so UI waits for backend actor/canister readiness and avoids "Actor not available" errors

projectName: Stabilize onboarding flow to prevent “Actor not available” errors
